title: Consider the following code snippet:  for (var i = 0; i < 5; i++) {   var btn = document.createElement('button');   btn.appendChild(document.createTextNode('Button ' + i));   btn.addEventListener('click', function(){ console.log(i); });   document.body.appendChild(btn); } (a) What gets logged to the console when the user clicks on “Button 4” and why?  (b) Provide one or more alternate implementations that will work as expected.
